Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2010 02:16PM KimberlyRae wrote: Thank you Gutsy....
Posts.Title: Possible IBC Mammo and ultrasound today... KimberlyRae KimberlyRae

Posts.Content: Jul 9, 2010 03:12AM KimberlyRae wrote: The mammo showed a mass but no calcifications, appointment on Tuesday with Dr. to set up biopsy. Thank you for your kind words.... I feel like such a baby whining about needles when most of you have had so much done to you with chemo and surgery... thank you for your compassionate words, they mean so much. I'm trying not to obsess the next five days. Keeping myself busy with my Bible studies and house work and other projects..... oh and comedies. I was my mother in law's caregiver when she was battling ovarian cancer, her greatest way to deal with the pain and anxiety was comedy.... I'm yammering now. I took something for my anxiety and I'm watching 'The Wedding Date'. I'll write when I know more. I still can't stop thanking you.... your words, all of you, mean so much.
Posts.Title: Possible IBC Mammo and ultrasound today... KimberlyRae KimberlyRae

Posts.Content: KimberlyRae wrote: Ironic enough, before I went to the Dr. I couldn't sleep worth a darn, worried about the mass I found in my breast that radiates up to my arm and the fact that it's swollen with red spots... now since seeing the Dr. yesterday (General Prac) I actually got some sleep. Probably since he got the ball rolling right away, meaning I have a mammogram and ultrasound today and immediate follow up on Friday, he's also contacted my surgeon from my lumpectomy (benign) in 05. These symptoms are so much different than the ones in 05... swelling, itching, and it 'feels' like something's wrong. Dr. also requested CBC labs today. This probably sounds really babyish, but the breast cancer I can probably handle, beat in fact... but the prospect of all the IV's and needles is scaring the crap out of me. I know I'll have a great support system, it's the pain I am afraid of, and the needles. Sigh....  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Possible IBC Mammo and ultrasound today... KimberlyRae KimberlyRae

Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2010 02:08PM KimberlyRae wrote: Thank you.... I am not alone in that LOL. Right now I'm in the midst of all the tests and waiting for diagnosis.... LOL. I have been looking things up.... that's how I found this site.
